text: Still watching Dragon Ball Super weekly and enjoying it for what it is. Another great track from this game, and it fits the late upload. The original is actually from DBZ's American soundtrack (Palace in the Clouds) which I always liked, but this really builds on it.
author: SupraDarky

text: I never understood why Bruce Faulconer's soundtrack for DBZ got so much hate. It's what a lot of us who watched it on toonami grew up with. It's a shame it's so hard to find nowadays
author: Gouzaku Fuwachi

author: TheGasty42

text: Does Faulconer's soundtrack really get that much hate? TeamFourStar doesn't like it, so they don't use it for DBZ Abridged for the most part, but I thought most fans loved it.
author: drunyon214

text:
I'm not sure honestly. All my experiences with DBZ fans have shown a general disdain towards Faulconer's music, but maybe I've just had shit dealings with fans?


Either way, I love it. But it seriously is a pain in the ass to find.
author: Gouzaku Fuwachi

text: Bruce is the BEST
author: Collin 255

text: I believe Bruce got in Legalities because of stealing or using copyrighted music; something along those lines. That's why many people now don't appreciate his work
author: mikeal123456789

text: I think you're thinking about a Japanese composer who made songs for the Budokai games, he also worked on some of the anime's compositions. I don't think Bruce outright plagiarised any music, however, I have heard that he took credit for a bunch of songs that he had no hand in making. Whether that's true or not I cannot say, but take it as you will.

text: I dont get why fans hate bruce's music. I think they're epic pieces of music that fit dragonball z perfectly. Granted i did grow up on them however i dont believe they should be hated.
